trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a new mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a new mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: In the bottom left of the window, click +NEW.
trans-unit.target: In the bottom left of the window, click +NEW.

trans-unit.source: Scroll until you see the Mobile App item.
trans-unit.target: Scroll until you see the Mobile App item.

trans-unit.source: This displays the New Mobile App blade.
trans-unit.target: This displays the New Mobile App blade.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: It must be at least 8 characters long and lowercase a to z.
trans-unit.target: It must be at least 8 characters long and lowercase a to z.

trans-unit.source: Select a region.
trans-unit.target: Select a region.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we use South Central US.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we use South Central US.

trans-unit.source: As part of this tutorial, you create a new SQL Database instance and server.
trans-unit.target: As part of this tutorial, you create a new SQL Database instance and server.

trans-unit.source: You can reuse this new database and administer it as you would any other SQL Database instance.
trans-unit.target: You can reuse this new database and administer it as you would any other SQL Database instance.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a database in the same region as the new mobile app backend, you can instead choose Use existing Database and then select that database.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a database in the same region as the new mobile app backend, you can instead choose Use existing Database and then select that database.

trans-unit.source: The use of a database in a different region is not recommended because of additional bandwidth costs and higher latencies.
trans-unit.target: The use of a database in a different region is not recommended because of additional bandwidth costs and higher latencies.

trans-unit.source: Select your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Select your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Create a new resource group with the same name as your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Create a new resource group with the same name as your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: In Package Settings, select USERDATABASE, you can choose an existing database or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: In Package Settings, select USERDATABASE, you can choose an existing database or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: For creating a new database, type the name of the new database, create a new server, type the name of that server, then choose a login name, which is the administrator login name for the new SQL Database server, type and confirm the password, and click the ok button to complete the process.
trans-unit.target: For creating a new database, type the name of the new database, create a new server, type the name of that server, then choose a login name, which is the administrator login name for the new SQL Database server, type and confirm the password, and click the ok button to complete the process.

trans-unit.source: If selecting an existing database, you will need to provide a Server Administrator Password.
trans-unit.target: If selecting an existing database, you will need to provide a Server Administrator Password.

trans-unit.source: Create a new webhosting plan with the same name as your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Create a new webhosting plan with the same name as your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Type your webhosting plan name, do not copy/paste.
trans-unit.target: Type your webhosting plan name, do not copy/paste.

trans-unit.source: There is name validation on this field that fails if you don't type the name.
trans-unit.target: There is name validation on this field that fails if you don't type the name.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't have to be exactly the same name as the website (but it needs to follow the same rules).
trans-unit.target: It doesn't have to be exactly the same name as the website (but it needs to follow the same rules).

trans-unit.source: Select a Pricing Tier.
trans-unit.target: Select a Pricing Tier.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we use Standard 1.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we use Standard 1.

trans-unit.source: Your new mobile app settings page will now look something like this:
trans-unit.target: Your new mobile app settings page will now look something like this:

trans-unit.source: Click the Create button at the bottom of the blade and you should see it starting deployment in the notifications window.
trans-unit.target: Click the Create button at the bottom of the blade and you should see it starting deployment in the notifications window.

trans-unit.source: You have now created a new mobile app backend that can be used by your mobile apps.
trans-unit.target: You have now created a new mobile app backend that can be used by your mobile apps.

trans-unit.source: After your mobile app is created, navigate in the portal to the sql server you just created (be sure to select the server and not the azure sql db).
trans-unit.target: After your mobile app is created, navigate in the portal to the sql server you just created (be sure to select the server and not the azure sql db).

trans-unit.source: From there, click the settings part, expand the firewall part, and change the "Allow access to Azure services".
trans-unit.target: From there, click the settings part, expand the firewall part, and change the "Allow access to Azure services".

trans-unit.source: If you don't do this, your application won't work.
trans-unit.target: If you don't do this, your application won't work.
